protocol_name: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
description:
The OmniPrep™ kit isolates high quality genomic DNA from many different species and tissue types including animal, plant, bacteria, yeast, fungi, whole blood, and cells in culture. DNA can be isolated from samples high in polysaccharides or other contaminants that are difficult to remove from the DNA preparations.

 

This protocol is for use with parafin-embedded tissue. Please refer to the appropriate protocol depending on your application.
before_start:
Proteinase K Solution: To avoid repeated freezing-thaw, dispense the Proteinase K solution into aliquots of 30µl/tube and freeze at -20°C.

 

Genomic Lysis Buffer & DNA Stripping Solution: If a precipitate forms due to cold storage allow to warm to room temperature until precipitate dissolves.

 

Use quantities for 2mg tissue.

collections.protocol_name: OmniPrep™ Protocol Collection for High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction
collections.protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ Protocol Collection for High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction

guidelines:
INTRODUCTION

The OmniPrep™ kit isolates high quality genomic DNA from many different species and tissue types including animal, plant, bacteria, yeast, fungi, whole blood, and cells in culture. DNA can be isolated from samples high in polysaccharides or other contaminants that are difficult to remove from the DNA preparations.

 

Several unique features separate the OmniPrep™ kit from other methods:

• A unique and proprietary formulation of detergents and salts. DNA can be extracted and purified from almost any tissue without the use of toxic agents such as phenol.

• A quick protocol, which isolates extremely clean genomic DNA. On an average, the DNA is 100kb in size and generally hydrates in minutes.

• Provides an option to modify protocol for difficult to handle samples.

• Suitable for 200 Preps (10mg/prep). The kit is adaptable for larger tissue volumes.

 

ITEM(S) SUPPLIED

Description Cat. # 786-136 Cat. # 786-136S
Genomic Lysis Buffer 100ml 2 x 2ml
Nuclei Isolation Buffer 2 x 30ml -
DNA Stripping Solution 10ml 0.5ml
Precipitation Solution 30ml 2ml
Mussel Glycogen (10mg/ml) 1ml 25µl
TE Buffer 20ml 0.5ml
Longlife™ RNase (5mg/ml; >60U/mg) 0.5ml 50µl
Longlife™ Proteinase K (5mg/ml) 2 x 0.5ml  50µl

NOTE: Cat. # 786-136S is a trial/sample size and does not contain enough reagents for all the protocols. For regular size kit, order Cat. # 786-136.

 

STORAGE CONDITIONS

The kit is shipped at ambient temperature. Upon arrival, store the kit components as recommended on the reagent label.

 

ADDITIONAL REAGENTS REQUIRED

• For all samples: Isopropanol, 70% Ethanol, and Chloroform

• For Gram positive Bacteria: Lysozyme, 0.5M EDTA. Longlife™ Lysozyme, (Cat# 786-037) available.

• For Yeast: Zymolyase® , β-mercaptoethanol, phosphate buffered saline (PBS). Longlife™ Zymolyase® (Cat# 786-036) available.

 

PREPARATION BEFORE USE

Proteinase K Solution: To avoid repeated freezing-thaw, dispense the Proteinase K solution into aliquots of 30µl/tube and freeze at -20°C.

 

Genomic Lysis Buffer & DNA Stripping Solution: If a precipitate forms due to cold storage allow to warm to room temperature until precipitate dissolves.

 

PROTOCOLS

The protocols contained in this manual are listed below and are based on the Extraction from Solid Tissue protocol. Thoroughly review the appropriate protocols before commencing isolation of genomic DNA. 

 

Use quantities for 2mg tissue.

 

TROUBLESHOOTING

• POOR DNA RECOVERY:

o Increase volumes of Genomic Lysis Buffer, DNA Stripping Solution and Precipitation Solution proportionally.

o Introduce optimal Proteinase K step after step 4.

o Improve grinding technique. 

• For efficient grinding of small samples we offer Molecular Grinding Resin™ (Cat. # 786-138), high tensile micro-particles that do not bind nucleic acids and are recommended for grinding and isolation of genomic DNA. 

• DNA/RNA free matching pestles and microfuge tubes (1.5ml) for grinding small samples are also available (Cat. # 786-138P).

 

• FOR >100kb GENOMIC DNA

o Recommend using MegaLong™ DNA isolation kit (Cat. # 786-146, 786-147). Isolates nuclei under mild condition, which are then transferred to Tube-ODIALYZER™ , a new device for DNA isolation. Nuclei are digested with protease followed by dialysis to remove protein and other contaminants. For more information call our Technical Department.

 

CITATIONS

1. Staley, C.A. et al (2012) Gene. 496:118

2. Jonkers, W. et al (2012) Appl Envir Microbiol 78:3656

3. Li, Z. et al (2010) Protein Expression and Purification. 72:113

4. Li, Z. et al (2010) Biochem and Biophys Res Comm. 402:519

5. Lorch, J. et al (2010) J Vet Diagn Invest 22:224

6. Li, Z. et al (2009) Protein Expression and Purification. 67:175

7. Lin-Cereghino, J. et al (2008) Yeast. 25:293

8. Choi, Y. and Shim, W. (2008) Microbiology. 154: 326

9. Choi, Y. et al (2008) Mycologia. 100:701

10. Whitaker, V. et al (2007) J. Amer. Soc. Hort. Sci. 132:534

11. Szabo, L. J. (2007) Mol Ecol Notes 7:92

12. Ordonez, M.E. and Kolmer, J.A. (2007) Phytopathology 97:574

13. Sagaram, U.S. et al (2006) Mol Plant Pathol 7:381

14. Mertens, J.A. et al (2006) Arch. Microbiol. 186:41

15. Lee, B et al (2005) Genome. 48:1104

16. Pliss, L. et al (2004) J. Neurochem. 91:1082

17. Jacobs-Helber, S. et al (2002) JBC. 277:4859

18. Li, X. et al (2002) Genome. 45:229

19. Villar, M. et al (2001) J. Bact. 183:55

 

Typical Yield: 0.25-1µg DNA /2mg tissue

components.data: Add 100µl xylene or safe xylene substitute and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with constant mixing. (wash 1/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl xylene or safe xylene substitute and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with constant mixing. (wash 1/3)

components.data: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 2 minutes and discard xylene or xylene substitute. (wash 1/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 2 minutes and discard xylene or xylene substitute. (wash 1/3)

components.data: Add 100µl xylene or safe xylene substitute and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with constant mixing. (wash 2/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl xylene or safe xylene substitute and incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with constant mixing. (wash 2/3)

components.data: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 2 minutes and discard xylene or xylene substitute. (wash 3/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 2 minutes and discard xylene or xylene substitute. (wash 3/3)

components.data: Add 100µl 100% ethanol and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature with constant mixing. (wash 1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl 100% ethanol and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature with constant mixing. (wash 1/2)

components.data: Allow the sample to cool to room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the sample to cool to room temperature.

components.data: Add 200µl chloroform and mix by inverting the tube several times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200µl chloroform and mix by inverting the tube several times.

components.data: Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 14,000xg and carefully remove the upper phase to a clean microcentrifuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 14,000xg and carefully remove the upper phase to a clean microcentrifuge tube.

components.data: Add 50µl DNA Stripping Solution to the sample and invert several times to mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50µl DNA Stripping Solution to the sample and invert several times to mix.

components.data: Incubate the sample for 5-10 minutes at 60°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the sample for 5-10 minutes at 60°C.

components.data: Add 100µl Precipitation Solution and mix by inverting the tube several times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl Precipitation Solution and mix by inverting the tube several times.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 12 of OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Solid Tissue (Fresh or Frozen)
source_data.protocol_name: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.annotation: A white precipitate should be produced, if not add 50µl aliquots of Precipitation Solution until a white precipitate forms.
source_data.thread_text: A white precipitate should be produced, if not add 50µl aliquots of Precipitation Solution until a white precipitate forms.
source_data.body: A white precipitate should be produced, if not add 50µl aliquots of Precipitation Solution until a white precipitate forms.

components.data: Centrifuge the sample at 14,000xg for 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the sample at 14,000xg for 5 minutes.

components.data: Transfer the supernatant to a clean tube and precipitate the genomic DNA with 500µl isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the supernatant to a clean tube and precipitate the genomic DNA with 500µl isopropanol.

components.data: Invert the tubes 10 times to precipitate the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the tubes 10 times to precipitate the DNA.

components.data: OPTIONAL: For increased DNA recovery, add 2µl Mussel Glycogen as a DNA carrier.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: OPTIONAL: For increased DNA recovery, add 2µl Mussel Glycogen as a DNA carrier.

components.data: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet genomic DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 14,000xg for 5 minutes to pellet genomic DNA.

components.data: Remove the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the supernatant.

components.data: Add 700µl 70% ethanol to the tube and invert several times to wash the DNA pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 700µl 70% ethanol to the tube and invert several times to wash the DNA pellet.

components.data: Centrifuge for 1 minute at 14,000xg.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 1 minute at 14,000xg.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 20 of OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Solid Tissue (Fresh or Frozen)
source_data.protocol_name: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.annotation: In some samples, the pellet may be hard to see at this point and will be loosely attached to the tube.
source_data.thread_text: In some samples, the pellet may be hard to see at this point and will be loosely attached to the tube.
source_data.body: In some samples, the pellet may be hard to see at this point and will be loosely attached to the tube.

components.data: Decant or pipette off the ethanol wash.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Decant or pipette off the ethanol wash.

components.data: Invert the tube on a clean absorbent surface for several minutes to allow any excess ethanol to drain away.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the tube on a clean absorbent surface for several minutes to allow any excess ethanol to drain away.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 22 of OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Solid Tissue (Fresh or Frozen)
source_data.protocol_name: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.annotation: Do not let the pellet dry completely or it will be difficult to rehydrate.
source_data.thread_text: Do not let the pellet dry completely or it will be difficult to rehydrate.
source_data.body: Do not let the pellet dry completely or it will be difficult to rehydrate.

components.data: Add 50µl TE Buffer to the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50µl TE Buffer to the pellet.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for at least 15 minutes to rehydrate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for at least 15 minutes to rehydrate.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 24 of OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Solid Tissue (Fresh or Frozen)
source_data.protocol_name: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.protocol_name_html: OmniPrep™ For High Quality Genomic DNA Extraction From Paraffin-Embedded Tissue
source_data.annotation: Incubating the tube at 55-60°C will speed up rehydration. Incubate for 5-60 minutes.
source_data.thread_text: Incubating the tube at 55-60°C will speed up rehydration. Incubate for 5-60 minutes.
source_data.body: Incubating the tube at 55-60°C will speed up rehydration. Incubate for 5-60 minutes.

components.data: OPTIONAL: 1µl LongLife™ RNase for every 100µl TE Buffer can be added at this stage.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: OPTIONAL: 1µl LongLife™ RNase for every 100µl TE Buffer can be added at this stage.

components.data: Store DNA at 4°C, for long term storage store at -20°C or -80°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store DNA at 4°C, for long term storage store at -20°C or -80°C.

components.name: Description

components.name: Description

components.data: Add 100µl Genomic Lysis Buffer and homogenize the sample with a microfuge pestle until a homogenous suspension is acquired, approximately 30-60 strokes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl Genomic Lysis Buffer and homogenize the sample with a microfuge pestle until a homogenous suspension is acquired, approximately 30-60 strokes.

components.data: Incubate the sample at 55-60°C for 15-60 minutes. Do not heat higher than 60°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the sample at 55-60°C for 15-60 minutes. Do not heat higher than 60°C

components.data: OPTIONAL: For maximum DNA recovery, add 1µl Proteinase K solution for every 100µl Lysis Buffer and incubate at 60°C for 1-2 hours. Invert the tube periodically each hour. This step will digest hard to handle tissues and significantly improve the yield.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: OPTIONAL: For maximum DNA recovery, add 1µl Proteinase K solution for every 100µl Lysis Buffer and incubate at 60°C for 1-2 hours. Invert the tube periodically each hour. This step will digest hard to handle tissues and significantly improve the yield.

components.data: Finely chop 0.5-2mg paraffin-embedded tissue and place in 1.5ml microfuge tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Finely chop 0.5-2mg paraffin-embedded tissue and place in 1.5ml microfuge tube.
